item.title: Beogram 4000: Replacement of Wiring Sleeve of Carriage Harness
item.description:
A Beogram 4000 turntable, previously restored in 2020, was brought in for repairs due to an oscillating solenoid issue. However, upon inspection, a more critical problem was discovered: the wiring harness sleeve was severely damaged, exposing the wires. This level of damage had never been encountered before. Thankfully, the wires themselves were still intact. The timing of the solenoid problem was fortunate, as further use could have led to wire damage...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/beogram-4000-replacement-of-wiring-sleeve-of-carriage-harness/

item.title: Beogram 4002/4004: Replacement of a Broken Cable Clamp/PCB Holder
item.description:
During the restoration of a Beogram 4002 (5513), a broken cable clamp/PCB holder presented an opportunity to test a replacement part file. A fellow Beogram enthusiast from New Zealand shared the file, and in return, received access to parts in my Shapeways store. Photos document the broken clamp, the 3D-printed replacement, and the final installation. The new clamp fits securely with the PCB, keeping the audio cable properly positioned. With the successful trial complete, the part was made available for purchase in my store for other B&O enthusiasts...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/beogram-40024004-replacement-of-a-broken-cable-clamppcb-holder/
